Public awareness and knowledge of geothermal energy is relatively low
energy is evaluated as less acceptable than other renewable energy sou
rces such as solar and wind, but
is preferred over fossil and nuclear energy, and in some studies, over hydroelectric energy
2019; Pellizzone et al. 2015; Steel et al. 2015; Hazboun and Boudet 2020)
people are concerned about the installation of geothermal facilities close to their homes, similar to solar
. The main concerns about geothermal energy, particularly for
temperature geothermal power generation plants, involve water usage, water scarcity,
Moreover, noise, smell and damages to the landscape
ave been reasons for protests against specific projects
implementation of modern technologies, geothermal presents fewer adverse environmental impacts.
the same time, people perceive geothermal energy as relatively environmentally friendl
The ocean is a vast source of energy
. Ocean energy can be extracted from
tides, waves, ocean thermal energy conversion (OTEC), currents, and salinity gradients
technical potentials, without considering possible exclusion zones, are explored below.
Tidal energy, which uses elevation differences between high and low tides, appears in two forms:
potential energy (rise and fall of the tide) and current energy (from t
harvestable tidal power from areas close to the coast is estimated as ~1.2 PWh yr
energy is estimated to be larger than that for tidal range or barrage
. Ocean wave energy is abundant and predictable and can be extracted directly from
surface waves or pressure fluctuations below the
) ,which means that wave energy alone could meet all global
The temperature gradients in the ocean can be
exploited to produce energy, and its total estimated available resource could be up to 44.0 PWh yr
. Salinity gradient energy, also known as osmotic power,
has a global theoretical potential of over 1.6 PWh yr
advantage of most marine energy, excluding wave energy, is that their sources are highly regular and
predictable, and energy can be furthermore generated both day and night. An additional use of sea water
cost district cooling systems near the sea
most marine technology advances is the relatively high upfront costs, uncertainty on environmental
pact, need for investments and insufficient infrastructure

energy (WTE) is a strategy to recover energy from waste in a form of consumable heat,
Thermal (incineration, gasification, and pyrolysis) and biological
(anaerobic digestion and landfill gas to energy) technologies are commonly used
When WTE technologies are equipped with proper air pollution reduction facilities they can
contribute to clean electricity production and reduction of GHG emissions. However, if not properly
In 2019, there were more than 1,200 WTE incineration facilities worldwide, with estimated capacity of
. It is estimated that treatment of a minimum of 261 million
